xml.description:
## Description
the IN2 input is a fast digital input capable of measuring 3.3 V (Maximum 5.5V) level signals. When an input voltage goes from 0V to 3.3V , it is known as a rising edge. The opposite is called a falling edge.
The rising edge timer is used to measure intervals between multiple rising edges, where you can select up to 4 number of events. The first edge initiates the timer, and is not returned to the user. So if 4 edges are requested, you will get 3 points in the returned list unless a timeout has occurred.
## Exercise
+ Set SQ1 frequency to 100 Hz, and connect SQ1 to IN2 using a wire. + Connect SQ1 to IN2, and measure the time interval between two rising edges. + Change it to 4 rising edges, and record the time. + Draw your conclusions.
